title: Updated data operator to better handle a join function which returns iden
body:
Updated data operator to better handle a join function which returns identical
values for multiple members of the data array.

For example, if a data array/join function is assigned such that the key value
"A" is returned 3 times, initially we would expect to see 3 corresponding
values in the returned entering selection -- as before.  However, if we again
pass the same data array/join function, we would expect to see no values in the
entering or exiting selections since the data and join are identical to what is
already in place.  However, the previous implementation would show values
exiting.  With this modification, if a given key is returned by the join
function n times, while the previous array had n0 occurrences of the same key,
then n0 corresponding entries will go in the updating selection, and n-n0 will
go to the entering or exiting selection depending on whether duplicates were
added or removed.

title: Additional types for d3.format.
body:
- `e`: exponent notation.
- `E`: same as `e`, except uses `E` as a separator.
- `g`: precision is interpreted as significant digits.
- `G`: same as `g` but uses `E` instead of `e`.
- `n`: equivalent to `,g`.
- `%`: percentages.

title: Add touch support to d3.behavior.zoom.
body:
Starting off with pan support.

What's the best way to support zoom? Tap, double-tap or pinch; or all of the above?

title: Add touch support to `d3.svg.mouse`.
body:
This doesn't quite seem like the right place for it, but it seems to work when using `touchstart`, `touchmove` and `touchend` handlers without any adverse effects on "true" mouse event handlers.

See http://www.jasondavies.com/apollonian-gasket/ to see an example of combined touch/mouse handlers working with this change.

title: Add kernel density estimation.
body:
Kernel density estimation is provided via `d3.stats.kde` and the kernel is configurable; several common kernels are provided in `d3.stats.kernel`.

I'm working on a ["beanplot" chart](http://www.jstatsoft.org/v28/c01/paper) that will make use of this, but I thought I'd separate it out and get your feedback.

title: Allow bound data to be cleared or inspected.
body:
- `data(null)` clears bound data from the current selection.
- `data()` retrieves the data bound to the current selection, as an array.

See #45.  I wasn't sure if my implementation of `data(null)` is the intended behaviour described in #45.  I assumed it wasn't intended to be the same as `data([])` (which would create exit nodes).

title: Propagate data changes to event listeners.
body: Event listeners are still bound to the index at the time of binding, but data changes are now visible from the event listener.

title: Polylinear scales.  Fixes #61.
body:
Note that I had to tweak the log scale unit test slightly because of a small floating-point difference in the value being interpolated: `0.49999999999999994` instead of `0.5`.

Based on the Protovis implementation.  I wonder if its worth retaining D3's multiplier cache, maybe only for simple `[x0, x1]` scales?

title: Add `brighter` and `darker` to d3.rgb().
body:
Based on the Protovis implementation.  Another possibility would be to have `d3.rgb.{brighter,darker}(rgb)`, any thoughts on which is best?

See also: #138.

title: Use "Object.keys" if available.
body:
Also added `hasOwnProperty` check in the fallback to avoid enumerating properties from the prototype chain.  This is the approach recommended in https://developer.mozilla.org/en/JavaScript/Reference/Global_Objects/Object/keys and elsewhere.

See also: #96.

title: Fix classed operator for SVG elements.  Fixes #78.
body:
Specifically, removal of a class wasn't working because the `className` property for SVG elements is an SVGAnimatedString, which has no `replace` method.

It would be nice to have a unit test for this, but env-js doesn't use SVGAnimatedString for this property.

title: Add monotone interpolation for lines and areas.
body: Based on the Protovis implementation.

title: Add doctype to all examples for consistency.
Add histogram layout.
body:
Next step will be to add `d3.chart.bar` and make them work together!

I wasn't sure whether the binary search function should be part of core or not.

title: Add animated merge sort example.
body:
Inspired by the phrase "reminiscent of wind gusting over tall grasses" in http://vis.stanford.edu/protovis/ex/sort.html.

I think it looks nicer to show the wind gusting along sequentially (each individual insertion) rather than whole merges occurring at once as in the original.  Easy to do when there's no space constraint :-)  Perhaps merge chunks could be colour-coded, but I think the splitting is fairly obvious towards the end of the animation.

title: Add d3.timer.immediate() for immediate transitions.
body:
This applies any queued zero-delay `d3.timer` callbacks immediately.  This is useful in situations where zero-duration transitions are used e.g. in generic visualisations that have a configurable transition duration.

It's often desirable to have zero-duration transitions for the initial setup phase (so that the visualisation displays immediately).  Immediate application (rather than waiting for the `setTimeout` callback to fire) avoids a delay of some milliseconds as well as an extra redraw.

See issue #48; I haven't made this invoke automatically for all event handlers as I wasn't sure where this change should go.

title: Add spline editor example.
body:
Essentially, the same as http://vis.stanford.edu/protovis/ex/splines.html but with transitions! I wonder if we can improve some of the transitions between interpolation types, or perhaps this is overkill?

I split the CSS and JavaScript for`line.html` into separate files as part of this commit assuming I would reuse `line.css`, but I ended up creating a separate `spline-editor.css` file anyway.

title: Add Q-Q plot.
body:
We should probably have a `d3.charts` helper for x- and y-ticks :-)

It might be nice to highlight deciles in a different colour e.g. as done in http://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/c/ca/Weibull_qq.svg

title: Small tweak.  Looks like d3_functor was replaced with d3.functor
body: update diagonals, use d3.functor instead of the removed d3_functor function

title: Replace "==" with strict equality checks "===".
body: I've been deliberately conservative about this, as it's not hugely important and I don't want to inadvertently introduce any bugs. I may take another pass at it, but these are the majority of the "safe" transformations. Feel free to ignore if you think it's pointless, it didn't take very long!

title: Boxplot chart
body: [Ask](https://twitter.com/#!/kelmiyashiro/status/57242330322841600) and ye shall receive!

title: Add support for appending/inserting #text nodes.
body:
This means isolated text nodes can be appended or inserted instead of creating superfluous `<span>` elements.

See issue #94.

title: Docs for d3.scale and d3.interpolate
body: Wrote up some notes on d3.scale and d3.interpolate. Some of the more complex options aren't documented, and the scales document is high level only. Hopefully it's better than nothing?

title: Add cluster (dendogram) layout.
body: Based on the Protovis version.  The only difference is that I've dropped the `orient`, `innerRadius` and `outerRadius` properties so that the D3 version is more flexible.

title: Add circle-packing layout.
body: Based on the Protovis layout.  I've kept the convention of using `size` for the width/height and `separation` for the spacing.  The Protovis layout had a `size` property but this was used to compute the radius. I've left this out as I've assumed it's straightforward enough to pass in the appropriate `radius` function instead.  Likewise, I think the existing hierarchy `sort` property can handle situations that `order` was intended for in the Protovis version.

title: Clamping for numeric scales
body:
I added a .clamped(boolean) method to d3.scale.linear, .log, and .pow, along with some simple tests. An alternate syntax would be .clamped() and make the true implicit.

See also https://github.com/mbostock/d3/issues/82 I didn't follow the interpolate suggestion because a scale can only have one interpolate function.

title: Add Reingold-Tilford tree layout.
body:
This is based on the Protovis layout; virtually no changes were needed
to the code aside from handling of previous and next siblings.

title: Remove broken links from examples index.
Fix for tick text not updating in bullet chart.
body: Just noticed this when playing with the random transitions: sometimes it would show a scale with 0, 0.5, 1.5, 2.5, … :-)

title: Bullet Chart
body: This is based on the Protovis version.  This initial commit is just to see if I'm on the right track, there are still a few things to add e.g. vertical orientation before it should be pulled.

title: Replace Tornado with SimpleHTTPServer in docs
body: I didn't delete the **main**.py file from examples; that may be a good idea.

title: Default filename `index.html` for examples server.
body: Mostly cosmetic :-) Just allows `/examples/` to be used instead of `/examples/index.html` for example.

title: API ref examples
body: I took a quick stab at documenting a couple of API methods: each() and attr(). Is this level of documentation useful to you? If so I will endeavor to fill in more docs at this level as I learn the API myself. If you'd rather write it all yourself when you have time, let me know and I won't meddle.

title: Replace Google's compiler with UglifyJS
body: Faster runtime, and smaller gzipped sizes: looks like a win/win!  The only downside is reliance on node.js compared with Java.  We rely on node.js anyway for testing plus we always publish minified versions so I don't think this is an issue.

title: Fix voronoi example for IE9
body: All the other examples worked great in IE9. The voronoi example filled the entire page so `overflow: hidden` was needed to fix it.

title: Workaround for no xhr.overrideMimeType in IE, including IE9
d3.call min bug
body:
This was a strange one; it seems Google's Closure compiler overoptimises d3.call to become:

```
function ea(a){arguments[0]=this;a.apply(this,arguments);return this
```

My fix becomes:

```
function ea(a){a.apply(this,(arguments[0]=this)&&arguments);return this}
```

I'm assuming `this` is always truthy, is that a fair assumption?  Alternatively we could have a utility function that sets `arguments[0]=this` and returns `arguments`.

I only noticed this when testing my demos as the D3 examples now use the unminified `d3.js`.  Is it worth adding a unit test for something like this?

title: Date scales.
body: Added a check to see if Date objects are used for the domain of a linear scale. If so, this code makes sure the date math works correctly and a new Date object is returned.

title: Polar stereographic projection
body:
Not sure about the naming: I started off trying to do a general stereographic projection but settled on just supporting polar projections for now. You can use `.hemisphere()` with `+1` or `-1` to change hemispheres. The southern hemisphere is remarkably empty :-)

I'm using `d3_radians`, which is currently in `albers.js`. I guess this should be moved to `geo.js`?

title: Fix d3_array for older browsers
body:
This uses the code from Sizzle.js as suggested in issue #42. It seems slightly annoying to rely on `document.documentElement.childNodes` being available, but I guess it's the best way to get hold of a `NodeList`.

I noticed another use of `Array.prototype.slice` in `src/core/ease.js`, should that be updated to use `d3_array`?

title: Fix for lack of `event` object in FF 3.6
Update examples index
body: I like to start with small patches and work up to the big ones ;-)

title: Small fixes to convex hull
body: Improved hull code to use a simpler (and more efficient) counter-clockwise test.

title: Added convex hull
body: Code for convex hull computation is in src/geom/hull.js. It follows the same input/output conventions as other geometric routines. I added a new example at examples/hull/ to showcase the functionality: click to add a new permanent point to the field.
